intro: Sertifera major, commonly known as the large sertifera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 10 centimeters in diameter. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a rough texture. Sertifera major is typically found in wetland areas and thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
